content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 2 to node 6 in the provided graph is:

2 -> 5 -> 6

Note that the path may include nodes more than once, but it will always be in the same order. If you change the destination node to node 6, the shortest path will be:

2 -> 5 -> 4 -> 6

which is the same as the previous shortest path minus the last node.

The shortest path from node 2 to node 4 in the provided graph is:

2 -> 5 -> 4

Note that the path may include nodes more than once, but it will always be in the same order. If you change the destination node to node 4, the shortest path will be:

2 -> 5 -> 4

which is different from the previous shortest path because it starts with node 5 and ends with node 4, while the previous shortest path starts and ends with different nodes.
